Key Match Events: Ireland's captain Andy Balbirnie smashed 62 to give his team a great start
England's batting lineup struggled to get any momentum, slumping to 29 for three with just one boundary in the first five overs
Moeen Ali and Liam Livingstone on batting duties at the Melbourne Cricket Ground
Rain stopped play in Melbourne, leaving England five runs short of victory
Post-Match Reflections: It’s amazing, kind of emotional,” said man-of-the-match Balbirnie. “Our message was to just create chances and we know how this England team like to play, if we take every chance then we would be in with a shot. This will do a lot to grow the game back home.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was abandoned due to rain, with the DLS scoring system leaving England five runs short of their target
Eighteen minutes were lost to rain at the beginning of the game
Others: England, among the tournament favourites, now face holders Australia at the MCG on Friday in a tough test for their World Cup aspirations
